question: What is Google Cloud Pub/Sub?

answers.text: A cloud-based file storage service
A managed messaging service
A cloud-based virtual machine service
A cloud networking service

question: What is the purpose of Google Cloud Pub/Sub?

answers.text: To store and retrieve files in the cloud
To manage virtual machines in the cloud
To publish and subscribe to messages
To provide DDoS protection for DNS

question: Which communication model does Google Cloud Pub/Sub use?

answers.text: Point-to-Point
Publish-Subscribe
Client-Server
Peer-to-Peer

question: What is a topic in Google Cloud Pub/Sub?

answers.text: A subscriber to a message
A category or feed to which messages are sent
A message queue
A unique identifier for a message

question: What is a subscription in Google Cloud Pub/Sub?

answers.text: A subscriber to a message
A category or feed to which messages are sent
A message queue
A unique identifier for a message

question: How does Google Cloud Pub/Sub handle message acknowledgment?

answers.text: It automatically acknowledges all messages
It requires explicit acknowledgment of each message
It acknowledges messages based on a predefined schedule
It acknowledges messages randomly

question: What is the maximum size of a message payload in Google Cloud Pub/Sub?

answers.text: 1 MB
5 MB
10 MB
Unlimited

question: What is the purpose of a subscription acknowledgment deadline in Google Cloud Pub/Sub?

answers.text: To automatically acknowledge all messages
To set a time limit for subscribers to acknowledge messages
To prioritize messages for acknowledgment
To delay message acknowledgment

question: What is the role of a publisher in Google Cloud Pub/Sub?

answers.text: To consume messages from a topic
To create and send messages to a topic
To subscribe to messages
To manage subscriptions

question: How does Google Cloud Pub/Sub ensure message delivery in the correct order?

answers.text: It prioritizes messages based on their size
It delivers messages randomly
It maintains the order of messages within a single partition
It relies on subscribers to reorder messages

question: What is the purpose of a push subscription in Google Cloud Pub/Sub?

answers.text: To pull messages from a topic
To acknowledge messages automatically
To deliver messages to an HTTP endpoint
To delay message delivery

question: What is the difference between a push and pull subscription in Google Cloud Pub/Sub?

answers.text: Push subscriptions deliver messages automatically, while pull subscriptions require manual acknowledgment
Push subscriptions require manual acknowledgment, while pull subscriptions deliver messages automatically
Push subscriptions deliver messages to an HTTP endpoint, while pull subscriptions require manual acknowledgment
Push subscriptions and pull subscriptions are functionally identical

question: What is the purpose of a dead-letter topic in Google Cloud Pub/Sub?

answers.text: To store messages indefinitely
To discard messages automatically
To store messages that cannot be processed successfully
To prioritize messages for delivery

question: How does Google Cloud Pub/Sub handle message retention?

answers.text: It retains messages indefinitely
It retains messages for a configurable period
It retains messages for a fixed period of 7 days
It retains messages for 24 hours

To prioritize messages for acknowledgment

To create a backup of messages

To enforce message encryption

answers.text: It guarantees strict ordering of messages across all partitions
It allows unordered delivery of messages within each partition
It randomly orders messages across all partitions
It relies on subscribers to order messages

question: What is the purpose of the Pub/Sub Emulator?

To provide free message processing in a local environment
To emulate the behavior of Google Cloud Pub/Sub locally
To enforce strict message ordering

To discard duplicate messages automatically
To store duplicate messages indefinitely
To acknowledge duplicate messages

question: What is the maximum number of subscribers for a single subscription in Google Cloud Pub/Sub?

answers.text: Unlimited
